intro: Bulbostylis capillaris f. stenantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bulbostylis, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats. The plant features slender, grass-like stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in spikelets, typical of the sedge family. This form is characterized by its more compact growth and narrower leaves compared to the typical form of Bulbostylis capillaris.
